oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pension document of Pvt. Stephen Johnson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This U. S. Department of the Interior, Bureau of Pensions document certified that Pvt. Stephen Johnson, Co. I, 4th Tenn. Cav., USA, was entitled to a pension of $24 a month. Johnson enrolled Jan. 17, 1864 in Cleveland, Tenn. and mustered in at Nashville. He went to convalescent camp in Nashville on Nov. 27, 1864, and was absent without leave from Jan. 11 until Feb. 27, 1865, and mustered out July 12, 1865. His service record stated that he was a farmer, with a fair complexion, blue eyes and light hair.
